name: Punthill Flinders Lane Apartments

reviews.text: Over all it is a great place to stay, centrally located, clean, friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Loud & noisy

reviews.text: Biggest disappoint is the outside noise levels experienced in our road facing room/apartment in Flinders Lane.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Through no fault of the Management or staff there has been road works in Flinders Lane over the last 2 nights of our stay (21 June - 25 June).
reviews.title: Loud ! Very loud ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I were woken in the early hours of morning (2am) by the work being done. Also by the rubbish collection every morning at 6am
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable and funky!

reviews.text: Recommend something should be done to limit the amount of outside noise experienced in these road facing rooms as this would make stay much more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Cheap wifi, funky decor and comfortable rooms

reviews.text: The rooms were nicely decorated and had everything you need. I loved the tin cat on the windowsill and the way the room was set out. The only problem was the previous occupants had been cooking in the room and the smell was overpowering and when we opened the window, the noise from the street was very loud. Overall the room was great and the location was excellent. I would definitely recommmend it.
reviews.title: Quirky

reviews.text: It is not glamorous but it is centrally located, clean, good amenities, friendly and helpful staff. And if you ring the hotel direct you get a good deal and usually you can cancel within 24 hours. The apartments are spacious and plenty of room to move around. The bathroom was huge and full kitchen like home. Didn't really like the rustic concrete interiors but still best value property in the city and I would definitely stay here again. 5 min walk to Rod Laver Arena, MCG, mall for shopping. I had a quiet room not overlooking the street.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this place. The two people who run it were extremely friendly and helpful. They helped me find coffee shops I'd like and explained in great detail how to order coffee how I like it in Australia (not as easy as it sounds, but they took care of it!)
reviews.title: Perfect apartment in a perfect location

reviews.text: The location was phenomenal. I can't stress how perfect this is for everything you'd want to do in the city. The property itself was in great shape and the apartments were very spacious. It had a lot of charm while also being very modern, extremely clean, and having everything we needed. There was a bit of noise from live music outside but it never bothered me.
reviews.title: Excellent location, but bring ear plugs

reviews.text: You could not find a more central location. Right in the heart of the CBD with lots of fantastic coffee shops, restaurants and bars in the vicinity. We had a studio apartment that faced Flinders Lane and the 24 hour noise should not be underestimated. Opposite is an office building and you can look right into these offices and the office workers can look right into your apartment. We found the apartment functional, however very dark. You need constant light and the dark carpet and furniture might be practical as it hides marks and stains, but it gives a depressed feeling and the cheerful little tin cat on the window sill doesn't make it better. The bed is comfortable, the bathroom small with a small shower cubicle. The airconditioning system is the noisiest we have ever encountered. Yes, the floors squeek, but it is an old building and can be tolerated. Housekeeping is slack. During our entire stay we never received any amenities. When we checked in there was not even a little soap, so we had to go to Coles Supermarket around the corner to get some as you do want to freshen up upon arrival. During our 4 nights in the apartment, there was no housekeeping at all on one day, on another day the blanket and pillows were just thrown over the bed. Tables were never wiped, floors never cleaned, bathroom just got a quick wipe over. Staff from Front Desk were very friendly and helpful. The price was reasonable for the location but we would probably prefer the Punthill Manhattan up the road where we stayed once in the past, simply for the better housekeeping and less noise.
reviews.title: Punthill Flinders Lane - best place in Melbourne - right in the heart of hip vibe of Flinders Lane

reviews.text: Love this apartment /hotel. Close to everything that we needed. Rooms were set up beautifullyand supplied all the kitchen gear you needed. We needed to travel to the country and train station next street made this easy. Food was readily available next door at the restaurants in the lane. Coles just around the corner and every takeaway you could imagine. Only down was the creaky floors and the slow lifts but even these were not enough to put our stay down.
reviews.title: Close to everything

reviews.text: I stay at Punthill apartments in Flinders Lane at least every two months for a period of 4 days at a time. Since renovations the rooms are modern and have everything you need. You can request a quiet room in the middle of the floor and they will always provide this. It is central to shopping and business. You don't need room service as many, many restaurants and cafes nearby. It is easy to buy takeaway and bring it back to your room as all cooking facilities provided. The price is very reasonable and hopefully won't increase like many other Melbourne apartment type of accomodation has.
reviews.title: Always Stay Here When In Melbourne

reviews.text: Stayed for 9 nights with the family of 6 for the Australian Tennis Open. First time to visit Melbourne. This hotel is right smack bang in the middle of everything you'd want to visit. Walk to everywhere. The free circle tram station is just round the corner and the busy lanes filled with cafes is just next door! Rooms are kept clean and the friendly staff are always helpful. I would highly recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first time in a 1 bedroom apartment on level 5. Didn't get any street noise, was very quiet to sleep in. We didn't face the street so it was very quiet. Huge bed and very comfy. Loved the New York loft look and had everything we needed ... full kitchen, washing machine, all the bits and pieces we needed. Only bit we didn't like was the shower over the bath was a bit skinny and bathroom a little tired. Otherwise, friendly helpful staff and a pleasure to stay here. Close to cool cafes, restaurants, movies, etc. Thanks.
reviews.title: Close to everything & great room

reviews.text: We spent one night for a concert and it was perfect in every way. Location, clean, friendly staff and well priced.
reviews.title: Just Right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These apartments have an excellent location - near the tram and railway so its easy to reach other parts of the city. A little bit noisy when its garbage collection day though as you can hear the trucks on the street quite loudly but other than that the noise isnt bad.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Loved the room itself - we stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was well equipped with a kitchen, small dining table, lounge with flat screen tv. Funky decor and a very comfortable bedroom.
reviews.title: Very large room, great value, fantastic overall!

reviews.text: Loved that we could just walk around the corner and have breakfast at one of the cafes on the street. Easy to reach the main streets for shopping and to other restaurants within the district. Close to federation square and a short walk to the Southbank promenade.
reviews.title: Good location but poor layout and bad customer service

reviews.text: All in all we were extremely happy with these apartments and would recommend it to anyone who wants an alternative to a hotel for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Four night stay ruined by poor customer service

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a few days prior to a conference for some R&R. I was really pleased with the large size of my room - it was a full 1-bedroom suite with full kitchen. The hotel was furnished modernly and comfortably. The location in the heart of the CBD could not be beaten and I enjoyed the convenience of stepping right out into the city from the hotel. Only minus was that at night there is a pub right outside on the street so I heard loud drunken young people fairly late. This was not a problem for me as I always travel with earplugs, although otherwise it would have been an issue. As a solo female traveler I felt very safe, and was able to walk and take the tram everywhere with ease. Front desk was friendly and helpful, loaning me an umbrella one day when I was caught without one and storing luggage securely.
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodation in the heart of Melbourne!!!

description: The most vibrant part of Melbourne CBD. Punthill Flinders Lane is surrounded by fashion, food and culture reflecting the ambiance and charm of Melbourne's quirky laneways and eclectic cafes. Punthill Flinders Lane is a short stroll to Federation Square, Regent Theatre, Southbank and Crown Casino. Sporting Venues such as AAMI Stadium, Rod Laver Arena, MCG and Etihad Stadium are also within close proximity.
